title: Drowning
description: On “Drowning,” A Boogie and Kodak rap about flexing jewelry and riches. They made it from the bottom and are now two of the hottest rappers in the game. On ‘Drowned,’ they make it from a bottom to a top rap duo. The duo rap about how they made it to the top of the rap game.

annotations_with_timestamps.annotation: Shottas is one of my favorite movies. It's a Jamaican movie. It’s a tradition that when people are missing, they have their faces put on milk cartons as a sort of missing poster. Wayne, he was wilding in there. He's in there making moves. Sniper Gang is Kodak's label. He says that he's going to put someone on a carton. By this he means he is going to kill you.

“Projects” refers to a type of government subsidized housing, exclusively for the low income. Actavis is a drug manufacturer known for their promethazine\codeine cough syrup. “Chopper” is also slang for an automatic firearm; Kodak always has a gun with him. Harley Davidson is a famous motorcycle manufacturer specializing in choppers, which have had their original factory frames modified and replaced with custom parts.

The rapper says he wants to have two billion dollars worth of jewelry. He says he's not done: "I can’t just have one million, I gotta have a billion" The rapper also says his mom is good and his family is good: "Long gone out the hood" He says winning a Grammy is one of his top five goals: "That’s top five"

High Bridge, I feel like, we relate to them in a way. The way we’re coming up right now. Even though it’s not as real as it was with the police and all that, it's still real. My friends right now is gone because of that police thing, feel me? For a long time. Ain’t nothing we could do about that.

Being from New York, it’s hard for another neighborhood in the Bronx to get along with another neighborhood, he says. “Ladder” is slang for an extended clip or magazine for a firearm. “9” or a 9mm is a powerful handgun cartridge. As of 2013, it's the most popular choice among the entire cartridge market.

'Icy' is a slang term used by rappers to compare diamond encrusted pieces of jewelry to the way that ice gleams. The term has been used throughout hip-hop culture by many rappers including Drake, Nicki Minaj and Gucci Mane. A “Cuban” is referring to a Cuban link chain, and when he says “dipped it in a fountain” he means to add diamonds to the Cuban link.

Avianne & Co Jewelers is a flagship store for hip-hop and pop culture–focused jewellery specialising in diamonds and watches. This line references the legendary hip hop group NWA (Niggaz Wit Attitudes) which consisted of Ice Cube, Dr. Dre, Eazy E, MC Ren, and DJ Yella. The rap group is from Compton, California.

This is a reference to Jamaican crime film Shottas, which is about two young men who participate in organized crime in Kingston, Jamaica. Even though he isn’t Jamaican, he has an assortment of guns, awaiting to take down his enemies. Boogie loves his friends, but he can make his way on his own. The film is based on the book, "Shottas"
